decks.notes: The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck revolves around aggressively attacking the opponent and quickly overwhelming them with powerful creatures. The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures such as Questing Beast, Brushfire Elemental, and Lovestruck Beast to deal consistent damage. It also includes powerful spells like Embercleave and Primal Might to enhance the damage output. Additionally, the deck incorporates cards like Shatterskull Smashing and Cragcrown Pathway to provide mana consistency. Overall, the goal is to establish a strong board presence and apply relentless pressure to put the opponent on the backfoot.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy using mostly green cards. The deck focuses on playing creatures with powerful abilities, such as Gilded Goose, Lovestruck Beast, Wicked Wolf, and Feasting Troll King, to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Trail of Crumbs and Witch's Oven to generate card advantage and maintain a steady stream of threats. The deck also includes a few utility cards like Vivien, Monsters' Advocate and Kogla, the Titan Ape for additional value and versatility.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and efficient removal spells, while also utilizing The Great Henge for card advantage and Embercleave for additional damage. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent through a combination of resilient threats like Questing Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, while also benefiting from the ramp provided by Kazandu Mammoth and Edgewall Innkeeper. The inclusion of efficient removal spells like Primal Might and Embereth Shieldbreaker helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for aggressive attacks.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of mill, disruption, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Ruin Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, and Drown in the Loch to mill the opponent's deck, alongside counterspells like Didn't Say Please and Essence Scatter, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By generating card advantage with Soaring Thought-Thief and Into the Story, the deck can maintain control of the game while gradually grinding the opponent out of resources, eventually leading to victory.

The key concept of the deck is to quickly establish a dominant board presence by playing aggressively with a mix of powerful creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Kazandu Mammoth and Lovestruck Beast, while also utilizing card draw from Edgewall Innkeeper. Key cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Brushfire Elemental provide significant damage output, while Embercleave acts as a powerful finisher. The inclusion of The Great Henge provides additional card draw, ramp, and a boost to the deck's larger creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures and combat tricks in order to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing aggressive creatures like Questing Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, along with powerful equipment like Embercleave, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and end the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Edgewall Innkeeper provide card advantage and additional resources to help maintain tempo and push through for victory.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Bonecrusher Giant to apply pressure on the opponent. Using cards like Brushfire Elemental and Embercleave, it aims to deal a significant amount of damage efficiently. Edgewall Innkeeper helps with card draw while Shatterskull Smashing can serve as removal or a finishing blow. The inclusion of The Great Henge provides additional value and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and pump spells.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and leveraging graveyard synergy. By combining removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures like Soaring Thought-Thief and Ruin Crab, the deck aims to control the game tempo and ultimately win through a combination of mill and damage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional recursion and value, further enhancing the deck's ability to outlast and outpace opponents.

The key concept of this deck revolves around controlling the opponent's actions and disrupting their strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and theft effects. The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of spells, such as Essence Scatter, Heartless Act, and Mystical Dispute, to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. Furthermore, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and resilience, ensuring the deck has a consistent and powerful presence throughout the game.

The deck focuses on using control and mill cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building card advantage through drawing and stealing cards. It aims to control the game by countering threats, removing creatures, and milling the opponent's library to win through decking them out. It also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to bring back valuable cards from the graveyard. The key strategy revolves around managing resources efficiently, disrupting the opponent's plans, and maintaining card advantage to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply early pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board. It aims to mill the opponent's library with cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer while also countering key spells with Drown in the Loch and disrupting the opponent's hand with Didn't Say Please. The deck also includes card draw and card advantage engines like Into the Story and Gadwick, the Wizened to maintain momentum and finish off the opponent quickly with evasive threats like Zareth San, the Trickster.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal and counter spells while generating value from ETB effects with Yorion, Sky Nomad. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Skyclave Apparition, while also generating card advantage and recurring threats with Dance of the Manse. The deck also includes ways to gain life and draw cards to stay ahead in the resource game. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and grind them out with powerful control tools.

This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to generate value from flickering permanents. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Heartless Act and Skyclave Apparition, along with enchantments like Elspeth Conquers Death and Elspeth's Nightmare for additional control elements. The deck also runs a few counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Negate to protect its board state. With a focus on generating card advantage and controlling the game, this deck aims to outvalue opponents over the course of a long game.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. The key strategy involves playing creatures with high power and utilizing cards like Embercleave to enhance their damage output. The Great Henge provides a steady stream of card advantage and life gain, while The Akroan War can help control the opponent's board. Fabled Passage and Cragcrown Pathway ensure consistent mana fixing, while the rest of the deck is filled with aggressive creatures and removal spells to maintain pressure on the opponent.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on aggressive early game plays to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestuck Beast, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and end the game quickly. Cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge provide additional power and value to push through for lethal damage. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while staying ahead on board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and aggressive spells. By efficiently ramping up mana and playing impactful threats like Bonecrusher Giant, Questing Beast, and Embercleave, the deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge provide additional card advantage and mana ramp, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive pace throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Wicked Wolf, Kazandu Mammoth, and Lovestruck Beast. The key strategy is to ramp up mana with cards like Gilded Goose and Castle Garenbrig to play powerful cards like Feasting Troll King and The Great Henge. The deck also includes cards like Trail of Crumbs and Witch's Oven for card advantage and creature recursion. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures and powerful threats while maintaining a solid mana base.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful spells and creatures, controlling the board with removal and counterspells, and finishing off opponents with big threats like Genesis Ultimatum and Terror of the Peaks. The inclusion of Obosh as a companion allows for additional damage output. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by generating card advantage through creatures like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. The mana base is also configured to support the deck's three-color requirements efficiently. Ultimately, the strategy revolves around establishing board presence and overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells.

The main concept of this Temur Control deck is to ramp up quickly using cards like Cultivate and Fabled Passage to get to your powerful late-game threats such as Terror of the Peaks and Genesis Ultimatum. The deck also includes key creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board early on. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a Companion offers a unique twist, emphasizing odd-costed cards like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant for added value. The deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells.
